title: Channel Your Inner ’90s Supermodel With These Expert-Loved Brown Lip Liners
description: Fan-favorite picks from Make Up For Ever, Fenty Beauty, Glossier, and more.
excerpt: Makeup experts share the best brown lip liners for all skin tones. Read on to discover the perfect shade for you.

html:
Best Lip Liner for Deeper Complexions

Ami Colé Soft Shape Lip Liner, Midnight

Pros
  • Universally flattering for deep skin tones
Cons
  • Staying power could be better

A lip liner should do more than create a border for your lipsticks and lip glosses—it should also soothe and nourish. Ami Colé’s formula does exactly that with the help of shea butter, marula oil, and vitamin E. It’s no wonder it’s a staple in the makeup kits of artists like Jaleesa Jaikaran, who favors these lip liners because “their deeper shades account for those with deeper hues. Ami Cole liners are a staple in my professional and personal makeup kit,” she tells ELLE.com.

Shades: 5

Sephora rating: 4.9/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I’ve used and sharpened this lip liner so much it’s basically a mini liner now—that’s just how good it is. My lips are typically lined with eyeliner instead of a traditional lip liner because eye and brow formulas last longer on the lips. However, this lip liner truly rivals my favorite formulas because it has a buttery smooth application and has a deep brown shade that pairs well with Ami Colé’s lip glosses.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Best for Beginners

Tarte Maracuja Juicy Lip Liner, Brown

Cons
  • More options for deeper tones

Baltimore reaches for these lip liners because they “are easy to use with a built-in sharpener for convenience.” For those using a drying lipstick, rest assured this lip liner can provide the nourishment needed. Like Tarte’s cult-favorite lip glosses, the liner is formulated with maracuja, along with conditioning hyaluronic acid and vitamin E.

Shades: 8

Ulta rating: 4.4/5 stars

An Ulta reviewer says: “I tried this lip liner on a whim and have stayed with it ever since, and here we are years later. I have multiple colors, but my everyday ones are Dusty Rose or Mauve. It doesn’t bleed and stays all day; it goes well under my lipsticks, although I often don’t even need it and just wear lip liner by itself. I love that it doesn’t dry out my lips.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Multipurpose Liner

Make Up For Ever Artist Color Pencil Longwear Eye, Brown & Lip Liner, Dimensional Dark Brown

Pros
  • Suitable for use on the eyes, brows, and lips
Cons
  • Will have to sharpen often for a smooth application

Regardless of your skill level, having this pencil in your arsenal will be a game-changer. The formula is designed for use on your lips, brows, and eyes, simplifying your makeup routine.

Shades: 11

Sephora rating: 4.4/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “My hunt to find the deepest, sexiest dark brown lip liner stopped when I tested this pencil in Dimensional Dark Brown. The hue is deep enough that it’s almost black, but still has a gorgeous brown shade that complements whatever nude lipstick or gloss I pair it with. Plus, because the formula works for other regions on our face, it lasts way longer than I expected.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Best Overall

MAC Cosmetics Lip Pencil, Chestnut

Cons
  • Not deep enough for darker complexions

When it comes to lip liners, MAC Chestnut is a classic choice. The warm brown shade was probably everyone’s introduction to lip liners and looks flattering on most skin tones. “These liners are known for their rich pigment, blendability, and long wear,” says Baltimore.

Shades: 35

Nordstrom rating: 4.6/5 stars

Our expert says: “This is the holy grail and isn’t going anywhere. It's the perfect shade to help balance any lipstick, gloss, or lip oil. This liner has been my longest-used brown lip liner in my 12-year career.”—Jaleesa Jaikaran, makeup artist

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Plumping

Rhode Peptide Lip Shape

Pros
  • Creamy texture seamlessly glides on lips

Hailey Bieber’s latest beauty offering focuses on creating shape and dimension. Great for enhancing your Peptide Lip Treatment or on its own, the new lip contours are already an ELLE Beauty hit and a favorite of Jaikaran. “Rhode Peptide Lip Shape in “Flex” and “Move” are gorgeous and the texture glides on seamlessly. This has quickly become a favorite of mine, and I know I will need multiples,” says Jaikaran.

Shades: 11

An ELLE editor says: “Although this isn’t technically considered a lip liner, I use it to line and blur my vermillion border, which helps create the illusion of a plumper lip without looking like I colored outside the lines. Hailey Bieber named “Stretch” as one of her go-to’s for the ’90s-inspired look, and it’s become my favorite neutral milk chocolate brown to pair with anything from Chanel’s lipstick in Boy to Merit’s matte lipstick in Equestrian.”—Carol Lee, associate beauty e-commerce writer

Best Pigmented Lip Liner

Fenty Beauty by Rihanna Trace'd Out Longwear Waterproof Pencil Lip Liner, Coal Blooded

Cons
  • Will need to sharpen often for smoothness

As a performer, Rihanna knows a thing or two about a product’s lasting power. Therefore, it makes sense that her lip liners would not only be incredibly pigmented but would also last through yap sessions, meals, and drinks.

Shades: 10

Sephora rating: 4/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “When I say I like dark brown lip liners, Coal Blooded is exactly the hue I’m referring to. Not only does this creamy texture slide on my lips like butter, but the shade is so deep and pigmented that I look like an old-school vixen in just one swipe.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Texture

Charlotte Tilbury Lip Cheat Lip Liner, Foxy Brown

Pros
  • Creamy, buttery finish
Cons
  • Needs more options for darker tones

A Charlotte Tilbury darling understands that no look is complete without a gorgeous, semi-overlined lip and lipstick. Even with a velvety texture, this liner offers precision to expertly outline your lips for the perfect Hollywood glam finish Charlotte Tilbury is known for.

Shades: 23

Nordstrom rating: 4.6/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “Charlotte Tilbury’s Lip Cheat in Foxy Brown is perfect. No notes. Most lip liners eventually dry my lips out, but this one manages not to suck out all the moisture out of my lips and still stay in place. Plus it’s a delicious shade of chestnut brown that’s weirdly hard to find. This lip liner plus Charlotte Tilbury’s lipstick in Pillow Talk Medium has been my everyday lip combo for months at this point, and I can’t tell you how many people have asked about it. I lost my train on the purse in December, and those were the two products I was the most sad about losing and eager to replace.”—Carol Lee, associate beauty e-commerce writer

Best Long-Lasting Formula

Sephora Collection Retractable Waterproof Eyeliner, Matte Brown

Cons
  • Product finishes fast

You get the best of both worlds with this Sephora eyeliner. Yes, technically it isn’t designed for lips, but for those looking to reduce touch-ups throughout the day, this formula is both waterproof and long-lasting, built to last throughout whatever your day may bring.

Shades: 17

Sephora rating: 4.2/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “A a few years ago, I had my makeup done by a makeup artist who suggested I switch my lip liner for an eyeliner or brow formula to help my lip color last longer. My first purchase was this Sephora eyeliner, which is retractable—perfect for someone like me, whose vanity is no place for a tiny sharpener. This pencil stays put through my morning lattes and even lunch. And throughout the day, it fades to a subtle, natural outline around my lips.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Peel-Off Lip Liner

Sacheu Lip Liner Stay-N-Peel Off Lip Liner Tattoo, HEY-zel

If you’re an avid TikTok scroller, you’ve seen videos of people peeling something off the outline of their lips before applying a lip product. Sacheu’s peel-off lip liner is the culprit, beloved for its transfer-proof and long-lasting formula.

Shades: 7

Amazon rating: 3.7/5 stas

An Amazon reviewer says: “The process was so simple; mine dried down super fast and left a very pretty color when I peeled it off. Will be ordering another color!”

Best Transfer-Proof Liner

Glossier Lip Line Enhancing Hydrating Longwear Lip Liner Pencil, Bare

Pros
  • Transfer- and water-resistant
Cons
  • Not pigmented enough for darker skin tones

A blend of nourishing ingredients, like jojoba oil and fractional quartz, are found in this liner to keep your lips hydrated and moisturized throughout the day. Plus, it’s so lightweight and easily applies to the lips.

Shades: 9

Sephora rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “This is the best lip liner I have EVER tried!!! This needs some more hype. It lasts awhile, and the color is just so pretty. This is my new favorite lip liner!”

Meet the Experts

What is the best way to apply lip liner?

This is where your elementary school drawing skills come into play. “The best way to apply lip liner is to trace the natural lip line in short strokes, then blend the liner into the center of the lips with a brush or your fingertips,” Baltimore explains. “For added fullness, you can slightly overline, making sure to keep the overlining subtle for a more natural effect.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

What are some common mistakes to avoid when using lip liner?

“One common mistake is overlining too dramatically,” Baltimore says. After all, the point of a lip liner is to create a border for your lip products to ensure your finished look is clean and precise. “While a subtle overline can enhance the lips, going too far outside the natural lip line can appear unflattering, especially from a side profile. Blending the liner well is also important to avoid a harsh line that doesn’t match the rest of the lip,” she shares.

Experimenting with different shades is important to find the most suitable option for your skin tone. “Another mistake is using a lip liner that doesn’t compliment your natural skin tone—this is especially important for those of a deeper complexion whose lips are often naturally darker. Lastly, avoid skipping the blending step! A liner that’s too sharp or not blended into the lips can create an overly defined, harsh look,” she adds.
